title: Cloud Management - Design and deploy cloud offerings
content:
Eve, an enterprise developer, requires an AWS EC2 instance cloud offering for running an application on Amazon Web Services (AWS). She can go to the consolidated Service Portal, browse for the offering, and request it.

For the AWS EC2 instance to be available in the Service Portal as a cloud offering, you should design, publish, and configure it. The following personas are involved in getting the AWS EC2 instance cloud offering to be available in the Service Portal.

Persona Responsibilities

Stephen - Suite administrator

Configure tenant and enable Design and Deploy (DND) capability

Derek - Tenant Administrator

Administer tenant and configure user authorization

Add Aggregation Provider

Peter - DND Administrator

Create and publish an AWS EC2 Instance design

Add the published design to the catalog

Approve a service request

Eve - Service Portal User/

Enterprise Developer

Request for a cloud service offering from the Service Portal

Accept the cloud offering

The personas are limited to the above for this use case. However, you can configure different users to take up various responsibilities according to your requirements. For example, the DND administrator role can be further split into various roles like Service Designer and Catalog Administrator. For more information on roles and authorization, see Configure authorization for DND

Prerequisites

You have the Design and Deploy (DND) capability for Cloud Management installed. For more information on how to plan the system requirements, prepare the environment, and install Cloud Management, see the Install section. 

Use case workflow

The below illustration gives the workflow for configuring the product, publishing an AWS EC2 design, and requesting it from the Service Portal.

Follow the below sections for detailed steps. 

Configure Suite Administration

Persona Location
Stephen - Suite Administrator Suite Administration Portal

Follow the below steps to create and configure a tenant with Design and Deploy (DND) capability.

Configure email 

Follow the below steps to configure the Email settings to receive notifications. 

  1. Access the suite administration portal with the URL in the format https://<hostname>/bo. 
  2. Log in using the out-of-the-box suite administration user suite-admin. The password for suite-admin is set during the installation of the product.
  3. Go to Configuration > Email. Enter the values for the following properties and select Test Connection.
    • Mail server host - SMTP hostname
    • SMTP server port - SMTP server port
    • Mail Protocol - Select Mail Protocol as SMTP
    • Certificate  - Select Plain
  4. Once Test Connection is successful, select Save.

Create Customer, Account, and Users 

A user is associated with an account which in turn is associated with a customer. Follow the below steps to create a customer, account, and user.

Create a customer

  1. Go to the Customers tab and select New. Fill in the following parameters and select Save to create a new customer.
    • Full name - Cloud Design Offering
    • Short name - CD Offering

Create Account

  1. Go to Accounts and select New. Configure the following parameters and select Save to create a new account.
    • Shared Service type - Standard
    • Name - Cloud Design Acc
    • DB user login identifier - Login Name
    • Customer - Select the customer (Cloud Design Offering) created in the prior step.

Create Users

After creating a customer and account, create the following users for this use case.

  • Eve - who will be Service Portal User
  • Derek- who will be a tenant administrator
  • Peter - who will be a Design and Deploy (DND) administrator

Create an Operations Orchestration Administrator and a DND integration user.

  • OO_admin - Operations Orchestration administrator
  • DND_Integration_admin - Integration user
Eve - Service Portal user
  1. Go to Users and select New. Fill in the following details.
    • Account - Select the Cloud Design Acc created earlier. 
    • Role - Select Account User
    • Login name - Eve
    • First name - Eve
    • Last name - Jack
    • Email - Give a valid email address. 
    • Authentication type - DB
  1. Save the user details.
  2. Activate the user by selecting Active. 
  3. Select the Reset password. A reset password link will be sent to the email id configured while creating the user. Reset the password by accessing the link given in the mail. Don't set the password with a double-quote ("), forward-slash (/), or backslash (\) as these special characters aren't supported.
Derek - Tenant administrator
  1. Go to Users and select New. Fill in the following details.
    • Account - Select the account created earlier
    • Role - Select Account User
    • Login name - Derek
    • First name - Derek
    • Last name - H
    • Email - Enter a valid email. A password reset link will be sent to this email address
    • Authentication type - DB
  1. Save the user details.
  2. Activate the user by selecting Active. 
  3. Select Reset password. The reset password link will be sent to the email id given while creating the user. Reset the password by accessing the link given in the mail and following the instructions. Don't set the password with a double-quote ("), forward-slash (/), or backslash (\) as these special characters aren't supported.
Peter - DND Administrator
  1. Go to Users and select New. Fill in the following details.
    • Account - Select the account created earlier
    • Role - Select the value Account User
    • Login name - Peter
    • First name - Peter
    • Last name - B
    • Email -Enter a valid email. A password reset link will be sent to this email address
    • Authentication type - DB
  1. Save the user details.
  2. Activate the user by selecting Active. 
  3. Select the Reset password. The reset password link will be sent to the email id given while creating the user. Reset the password by accessing the link given in the mail and following the instructions. Don't set the password with a double-quote ("), forward-slash (/), or backslash (\) as these special characters aren't supported.
DND_Integration_admin - DND integration user
  1. Go to Users and select New. Create an integration user by filling in all the details. 
    • Account - Select the account created earlier
    • Role - Select Integration User
    • Login name - DND_Integration_admin
    • First name - DND_Integration
    • Last name - admin
    • Email - Enter a valid email. A password reset link will be sent to this email address.
    • Authentication type - DB
  1. Save the user details.
  2. Activate the user by selecting Active.
  3. Reset the password for the user. The reset password link will be sent to the email id given while creating the user. Don't set the password with a double-quote ("), forward-slash (/), or backslash (\) as these special characters aren't supported.

Configure Cloud Management License

A Cloud Management license is needed to access the Cloud Management functionality. Follow the below steps to create a license.

Create a license

  1. Go to Licenses and select New.
  2. Fill in the following details and select Save.
    • Name - HCMX License1
    • Edition/License - Select Cloud Management as the license type.

Create license pool

  1. Go to License-Pools > New.
  2. Fill in the following details and select Save.
    • Name - HCMX_Licensepool
    • Description

 

Add the license to the license pool

  1. Go to the license created earlier.

  2. In the License pool property, select the license pool created in the earlier section.

Create and configure a tenant

The DND capability needs to be enabled on a tenant. Create a new tenant or enable DND on an existing tenant. The below section gives steps to create a new tenant and enable DND. If an existing tenant is being used make sure that the backend type of tenant is SMAX.

Create a Tenant

  1. Go to Tenant > New.

  2. Fill in the following details

    • Account - Select the account (Cloud Design Acc) created in one of the previous sections.

    • Backend type - Select SMAX.

    • Name - Give a name for the tenant. Example - DND_tenant.

    • Type - Select the type of tenant.

Assign tenant admin

Go to Tenants and select the tenant that has been created. Select Derek as the tenant admin. Save the changes.


 
Assign a license to the tenant

Go to Licenses > Add. Select the license pool and the license that was created earlier. Save the changes.


 

Deploy the tenant

  1. Select Deploy.
  1. In the Deploy tenant popup, select Deploy. This will start the deployment process.
  2. Check the status of the deployment in the Tenants screen. On successful deployment, the tenant will become Active.

Deploy OO capability

The suite admin needs to deploy the OO capability on a tenant before deploying the Design and Deploy (DND) capability. To deploy the OO capability on a tenant: 

  1. Log in to Suite Administration as suite-admin: https://<External Access Host>/bo.
  2. Click Tenants and then open the tenant.
  3. Select the Capability settings tab, and then click Deploy new capability.
  4. In the Capability field, select Operations Orchestration. 
  5. Enter the OO integration URL and OO login URL.
    • For on-premises deployment, the OO integration URL and OO login URL are in the format https://<OO_HOST>:<OO_PORT>. For example, enter https://myoohost.example.com:9443 in both URL fields. 
  6. Click Next. The system starts the validation of the URLs you entered.
    • The URLs must start with https or http and mustn't contain a trailing slash (/).
    • The system can connect to the OO controller in the backend by using the OO integration URL you entered. 
  7. If the URLs have passed the validation, a note appears below the URLs, indicating that it's impossible to remove the OO capability once deployed. Select the checkbox for the note and then select Deploy. 
  8. The deployment starts. You can check the deployment progress on the Operation history tab of the tenant.
  9. Wait several minutes until the deployment is Done. 
  10. If the tenant admin has never logged in to the Agent interface, ask the tenant admin to log in: https://<External Access Host>/saw/dashboard?TENANTID=<Tenant ID>. This is because the system needs to replicate the relationship between the tenant admin user and the OO Administrators group from IdM to the Agent interface, and so you need to make sure that the tenant admin user already exists in the Agent interface. 
  11. Set Enable capability to On.
  12. Click Save.

    Note If the OO integration URL is invalid, an error occurs. Normally, this won't happen unless you have changed this URL by mistake after the previous URL validation in step 6. In this case, correct the wrong URL and then click Test Connection to validate this URL again and then click Save.

  13. Ask the tenant admin to do the following:

    1. Check that the seeded roles and groups are replicated to the Agent interface:

      Roles (Administration > People > Roles): OO Administration Role, and OO End User Role.

      Groups (Administration > People > Groups): OO Administrators and OO End Users.

    2. Check that the tenant admin user is assigned to the OO Administrators group.

Deploy DND capability

Follow the below steps to deploy the capability.

  1. Select the tenant and go to Capabilities Settings > Deploy new capability. A popup will be displayed.
  2. Select Design and Deploy and select Next.
  3. In the Config and deploy screen set the users as below
    • DND administrator - B, Peter
    • DND transport user - Admin, DND_Integration
  4.  Check the checkbox and select Deploy.
  5. The status of the tenant deployment can be seen in the Operations History tab.
  6. It will take some time for DND to be deployed successfully. Though the operation history indicates that DND is deployed successfully, the DND content installation may still be in progress.
  7. To check the content installation status, log in to the OMT management portal (https://<EXTERNAL_ACCESS_HOST>:5443), select CLUSTER > Dashboard > Workloads > Pods, and then check the status of the DND content installation pod itom-dnd-content-install-xxx-xxx.
  8. You need to wait around 1.5 hours for the content installation to be completed.
  9. After the capability and content are deployed, go to  Capabilities Settings, and set the Enable capability toggle to On.
  10. The URL displayed in the tenant details screen is used to launch the Service portal for the tenant. 

Configure authorization for DND administrator

By default, the tenant administrator has the privilege to access the Design and Deploy (DND) menus and data and doesn't require separate authorization.

Additionally, the suite administrator can also authorize other users to access the DND menus.

Peter is configured as the DND administrator. Follow the below steps to authorize Peter to access DND menus and Data.

Authorize user as DND administrator in IDM

Persona Location
Stephen - Suite Administrator Suite Administration Portal
  1. Log in to Suite Administration (https://<External_Access_Host>/bo) as the suite admin and get the account ID for the DND enabled tenant, such as 635912367. The account ID of the newly created tenant is the same as the tenant ID.
  2. Select IdM settings in the tenant details page 
  3. In the Group tab, select DND_ADMINISTRATORS, and then select the Edit icon.
  4. In the Associated Users field, add Peter as DND administrator.
  5. In the Group tab, select OO_ADMINISTRATORS, and then select the Edit icon.
  6. In the Associated Users field, add Peter as OO administrator.

Configure user role for menu visibility

Persona Location
Derek - Tenant Administrator Service Management Portal

Follow the below steps to authorize Peter to access the DND menus.

  1. Log in to Service Management as a Derek, and navigate to Administration > People > ROLES.
  2. Select CMP Agent from the left pane.
  3. Verify the following options are enabled.
    • General
      • Log in to the application
      • Permission to manage Service Design and Deployment
    • Reports and View
      • Create public reports
      • Define schedule tasks for email reports
      •  Create public favorite views
    • Record Type
      • Service Definition - Create, view, and update are enabled
      • Provider - Create, view, update, and delete are enabled. If any of the options aren't visible, you can add it using   button.
    • Administration menu visibility
      • Ability to view all administration modules

Follow the below steps to generate Key chain

  1. Launch the Service Portal using the tenant URL. 
  2. From the main menu, go to Administration > Application Settings.
  3. To create your tenant key chain:
    • Select Create tenant key chain.
    • Type and confirm your Passcode. The passcode of the key chain must be 10 to 20 characters long containing at least one upper case character, at least one lower case character, and at least one number. 
    • Select OK.

Create and publish Amazon Web Service (AWS) Instance Cloud Offering 

Persona Location
Peter - DND Administrator Service Management Portal

Configure Application settings

  1. Launch the Service Portal using the tenant URL and log in using the DND administrator credentials.  The user id will be Peter and the password will be the one you had set while resetting the password.
  2. Select Agent Interface. This will take you to the Service Management portal.
  3. From the main menu, go to Administration > Application Settings. Verify the following options are set.
    • Experience mode - Add Cloud Management option.
    • Enable Service Design and Deployment - Set it to On.
    • Enable Aggregation - Set it to On

Add DND as an aggregation provider

You need to add DND as an aggregation provider for the published design to be available for consumption. To add an aggregation provider:

  1. From the main menu, go to Administration > Providers > Aggregation Providers.
  2. Select New.
  3. On the New Provider page, fill in the following details and select Save.
Basic Properties Title field Give a descriptive name for the new provider
System type  Service Design and Deployment. After the System Type is selected, additional General and Integration user sections are displayed.
General URL

Type the URL of the provider system.
The URL must be https://itom-dnd-controller-svc:8444/dnd
Integration user Login name Give the DND integration user name DND_Integration
Give the DND integration user’s password

Configure AWS Deployment Resource Provider

Deployment Resource Providers are management platforms that offer centralized control over the infrastructure and resources used in a cloud computing environment. Follow the below sections to configure deployment resource providers and run a resource synchronization.

Configure Provider

Follow the below steps to configure AWS providers.

  1. From the main menu, go to Administration > Utilities > Providers > Deployment Resource Providers. 
  2. Select Amazon AWS.
  3. In the Properties tab set the proxy details.
  4. Select the gear icon and select Edit.
  5. Fill in the Access Point Configuration details in the Edit Resource Provider screen
    • Service Access Point
    • Access Key ID
    • Secret Access Key
    • Confirm Secret Access Key
  6. Tick the check box to enable the provider.

Perform resource synchronization for AWS provider

  1. Go to the Main Menu > Administration > Providers > Deployment Resource Providers > Amazon AWS > Resource Pool tab and select Create.
  2. Fill in the following details 
    • Display Name
    • Known By Provider As
  3. Select Resource Synchronization Action. Select EC2 Resource Sync v2.0 for AWS provider.
  4. Select Create after selecting the action.
  5. Select gear icon > Synchronize.
  1. To check the status of resource synchronization go to the Main Menu > Run > Automation Operations.

If you encounter any error, rectify it and run the synchronization again.

Create and publish an AWS EC2 instance cloud offering design

A service offering is created when you publish a design. You can use out-of-the-box (OOTB) designs or create a design of your own depending on your requirements. For this use case, we will be using an OOTB design.

  1. From the main menu, go to Build > Design.
  2. In the Service Designer tab, select AWS EC2 Compute Advanced. 
  3. In the Versions tab, select the version.
  4. Select the gear icon >Publish.
  5. Select Yes on the confirmation screen.

  
The design will be published.

Build Service Catalog

Persona Location
Peter - DND Administrator Service Management Portal

After publishing the design it needs to be added to the Service Catalog. Follow the below steps to add the published design to the Service Catalog.

Add new Category in catalog

From the main menu, select Plan > Service Catalog > Catalog. In the Category pane, add a category or select an existing category.

To add a category:

  1. Select Add. The New Category dialog box is displayed.
  2. Enter a Display label as AWS Offerings.
  3. Enter a Description. 
  4. Select a Background Image, Background Color, and Image, and enter a Display order and URL, as required. For detailed information, see How to design category tiles for the Service Portal.
  5. Select Save.

Add Service Definition

In the Service Definition pane, select Add. Fill in the following details. 

  1. Display label
  2. Select the appropriate Subtype
  3. Catalog description
  4. Save the service definition.
  5. From the Main menu, go to Build > Service Catalog > Service Definition tab.
  6. Select the service definition added and scroll to Catalog field and select the catalog AWS Offering from the drop down.
  7. Select Build and Save the changes.

     

  8. Once the build is complete, select Operate and Save. The Service Catalog will be available in the Service Portal.

Add Service Offering

  1. From the Main menu, go to Build > Service Catalog.
  2. In the Catalog tab, select the catalog AWS Offering created earlier. The Service Definitions defined for the catalog will be displayed.
  3. Select the Service Definition for which you want to add the Service Offering. Select the Service Definition for AWS Offering created earlier.
  4. A list of offerings is displayed. Select Add > Add an aggregated offering. The New Aggregated Offering dialog box is displayed. If you can not see Add aggregated offering,  make sure Enable Aggregation is set to On in Application settings.
  5. Select the published offering that needs to be added to the catalog.
  6. Select Next and define a display label for the offering.
  7. Save the aggregated offering. The offering can be updated with necessary approvals, entitlements/audience, pricing, user options, etc before making it active.
  8. Select the drop-down and select Activate. The offering will be activated.

Request AWS cloud offering from the Service Portal

Persona Location
Eve - Service Portal User  Service Portal
  1. Log in to Service Portal and select the category where the aggregated service offering is available.
  2. Select the offering and select Request Service.
  3. The service offering details page will be displayed. Fill in the details and select the option from the drop-down. The options in the drop-down are only available when Resource Synchronization for a provider is successfully completed. For steps to initiate the resource synchronization, see section Perform resource synchronization for AWS provider.
  1. Submit the request after filling in the necessary details.

Approve the service request

Persona Location
Peter - DND Administrator Service Management Portal

To approve the service request follow the below steps

  1. From the Main menu, go to Run > Service Request. 
  2. Select the service request from the list.
  3. Fill in the following details on the service request details page: Current assignment, and Service desk group 
  1. After the assignment is complete, the service request fulfillment will start. Wait for the fulfillment to get completed. Refresh to see a notice indicating that a notification is sent to the user for acceptance. Once the fulfillment process starts the DND administrator can monitor the status of the deployment on the Instance Management page.

View the status in Deployment Operations

To see the status of the request in Deployment Operations. 

  1. In the Service Management Portal, from the main menu go to Administration > Deployment Operations > Instance Management.
  2. View the status of the service request. Once the service request is fulfilled, the service instance will be in active state.

View service request details and accept the solution

Persona Location
Eve - Service Portal User Service Portal

Accept the solution

On the successful fulfillment of the Service Request, a notification will be sent to Eve for accepting the solution offered.

Go to the Service Portal as Eve and accept the offering.


   

View subscription details

View the status of the request in the Service Portal.

  1. In the Service Portal, go to Your Request. Select the service request submitted to see the status of the request.
  2. To get the details of the subscription created go to Service Portal > Service and Assets.
  1. Select the subscription to see the details.
  2. The details of the subscription will be displayed. From the Actions drop-down select Manage service instance.
  3. The service instance details will be displayed.
  4. Select the components to see the details. For this use case, the IP Address and hostname is required to log into the AWS instance provisioned. To get these details, select the option Amazon Server Template 18.2.1.
  5. The AWS instance is provisioned and it's ready for use. Use the hostname to log into the AWS instance.
